result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth R Carson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $3,000 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Follow all warnings regarding driving or operating machinery while taking prescriptions.

supervisions.notes: To commence when defendant is released from prison.
Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of drivers license revocation must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.
Obtain alcohol assessment through Door County Human Services and comply with treatment recommendations. Defendant has already attended a Victim Impact Panel session.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records staff member and will be based upon actual release date.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
Court responds - this is premature. We can wait till defendant is out of jail and then access his financial situation. DTE

records.addlTxt: from Plea & Sentencing Hearing dated 6-17-14

Defendant Kenneth R Carson in court with attorney Eric S Maciolek.  Defendant Kenneth R Carson in custody.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. Upon plea to OWI 8th in 12-CF-46, State moves to amend Ct. 1 to OWI 9th. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1 as amended.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of amended Ct. 1. Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties for felony conviction. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. Bond is no longer in effect.

Attorney Eric S Maciolek in court. Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding Motion filed by Defense, whether or not hearing is needed or if Court can rely on transcript from prelim, burden of proof.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenneth R Carson in court with attorney Eric S Maciolek. Defendant in custody. Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of global offer, has received psychological report but hasn't had a chance to review it, requests 30 days to determine if motion should be filed.  Status conference scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
of Preliminary Hearing held 3/28/14
Defendant was fingerprinted on 3/20/14. (fingerprint card destroyed 6/20/14)

Defendant Kenneth R Carson in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Defendant Kenneth R Carson in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas.  Defense is waiting for discovery and blood results.  Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
by State

Defendant Kenneth R Carson in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Defendant Kenneth R Carson in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Testimony taken.  Exhibit 1 - copy of bond in 12-CF-46 - offered and received. Court finds probable cause, binds Defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
by Defendant
Conditions remain the same.
State presents argument to increase cash bond.  Defense presents argument.  Court increases bond to $3500, will entertain further arguments from Counsel at prelim.

Defendant Kenneth R Carson in court, in custody.  Atty Eric Maciolek appeared by phone.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Not to consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then following all rules and cautions associated with those medications.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Kenneth R Carson appeared by video conference.  Attorney Eric S. Maciolek appeared by phone. Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 3/25/14, 1:15.
